text: Beach Vanderpool (October 25, 1808 – March 12, 1884) was an American politician who served as the Mayor of Newark from 1846 to 1848. == Biography == Vanderpool was a member of a prominent family in Newark. He was one of the founders of the Morris and Essex Railroad and was a major shareholder at the time of his death. He was also the president of the Howard Savings Bank and Commissioner of the Morris Plains Lunatic Asylum. One of his sons, Eugene Vanderpool (1844–1903), was president of the Newark Gas Light Company. ==References== Category:1808 births Category:1884 deaths Category:American people of Dutch descent Category:Mayors of Newark, New Jersey Category:New Jersey Whigs Category:19th-century American politicians
title: Beach Vanderpool
